metalign.joint

Class JointModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • metalign.generic.MidiModel
      • metalign.joint.JointModel

  • public class JointModel
extends MidiModel
    A JointModel is used to model and infer one of each type of model simultaneously as a set, one step at a time.
    Author:
    Andrew McLeod - 8 Sept, 2015

        private boolean started
        Have we started yet? False initially. Set to true the first call to handleIncoming(List).

    • Constructor Detail

      • JointModel

        public JointModel(VoiceSplittingModelState voice,
                  BeatTrackingModelState beat,
                  HierarchyModelState hierarchy)
        Create a new JointModel based on a state with the given constituent states.
        Parameters:
        voice - The voice splitting state to use.
        beat - The beat tracking state to use.
        hierarchy - The hierarchy detection state to use.

    • Method Detail

      • handleIncoming

        public void handleIncoming(java.util.List<MidiNote> notes)
        Description copied from class: MidiModel
        This method takes as input some List of MidiNotes, and then does some work on the notes, updating its list of hypotheses in the process.
        Specified by:
        handleIncoming in class MidiModel
        Parameters:
        notes - A List of the MidiNotes which we want to handle next.

      • close

        public void close()
        Description copied from class: MidiModel
        This method is called to tell the given model that the input has finished and to flush out all of its states.
        Specified by:

      • setGlobalStaticVariables

        private static void setGlobalStaticVariables()
        Set the global static variables to new blank objects. They are: newVoiceStates, newBeatStates, and startedStates.

      • printLog

        private void printLog(java.util.List<MidiNote> notes)
        Print the logging info for this step.
        Parameters:
        notes - The notes of the current step, or null if this comes from close().

      • fixForBeam

        private void fixForBeam(java.util.TreeSet<JointModelState> newStates)
        Remove those hypotheses which are outside the top Main.BEAM_SIZE finished hypotheses.
        Parameters:
        newStates - The ordered set of hypotheses.

      • fixForVoiceBeam

        private void fixForVoiceBeam(java.util.TreeSet<JointModelState> newStates)
        Remove those hypotheses outside of the top Main.VOICE_BEAM_SIZE voiceState scores which are also outside of the top Main.BEAM_SIZE overall scores. (Ties are kept in)
        Parameters:
        newStates - The ordered set of hypotheses.

      • getHypotheses

        public java.util.TreeSet<JointModelState> getHypotheses()
        Description copied from class: MidiModel
        This method returns a TreeSet of the current hypothesis states of this MidiModel.
        Specified by:
        getHypotheses in class MidiModel
        Returns:
        A TreeSet of the current hypothesis states of this MidiModel, sorted by score.

      • getVoiceHypotheses

        public java.util.List<? extends VoiceSplittingModelState> getVoiceHypotheses()
        Get an ordered List of the VoiceSplittingModelStates which are currently the top hypotheses for this joint model. These may not be sorted in order by their own scores, but they are given in order of the underlying JointModelState's scores.
        Returns:
        An ordered List of the VoiceSplittingModelStates which are currently the top hypotheses for this joint model.

      • getBeatHypotheses

        public java.util.List<? extends BeatTrackingModelState> getBeatHypotheses()
        Get an ordered List of the BeatTrackingModelStates which are currently the top hypotheses for this joint model. These may not be sorted in order by their own scores, but they are given in order of the underlying JointModelState's scores.
        Returns:
        An ordered List of the BeatTrackingModelStates which are currently the top hypotheses for this joint model.

      • getHierarchyHypotheses

        public java.util.List<? extends HierarchyModelState> getHierarchyHypotheses()
        Get an ordered List of the HierarchyModelStates which are currently the top hypotheses for this joint model. These may not be sorted in order by their own scores, but they are given in order of the underlying JointModelState's scores.
        Returns:
        An ordered List of the HierarchyModelStates which are currently the top hypotheses for this joint model.
